concepts.name: Sleep deprivation
concepts.description: A state of insufficient sleep leading to impaired physiological and cognitive functions, directly linked to digital habit disruptions in Gen Z learners. Central to the paper's mechanism explaining academic and mental health impacts.

concepts.name: Digital distraction
concepts.description: Excessive engagement with digital devices (e.g., nighttime screen exposure) that disrupts circadian rhythms and sleep architecture. Identified as a primary modifiable factor in sleep deprivation among students.

concepts.name: Cognitive function
concepts.description: Mental processes including memory, attention, and problem-solving abilities, shown to decline significantly with sleep deprivation. Serves as the key cognitive outcome measured in academic performance contexts.

concepts.name: Emotional regulation
concepts.description: The capacity to manage emotional responses and stability, negatively affected by sleep disruption. Explicitly tied to increased stress and mood fluctuations in Gen Z learners per the study.

concepts.name: Gen Z learners
concepts.description: A demographic cohort (born 1997-2012) characterized by high digital immersion and distinct sleep patterns. The primary subject group for analyzing digital-sleep-academic performance relationships.

concepts.name: Screen time exposure
concepts.description: Duration and timing of digital device usage, particularly nocturnal, correlating with reduced sleep quality. A critical behavioral variable in the study's causal pathway model.

concepts.name: Academic performance
concepts.description: Measurable educational outcomes (e.g., grades, cognitive task efficiency) impaired by sleep disruption. The primary dependent variable demonstrating real-world impact of digital habits.

methods.name: Cross-sectional survey
methods.description: A single-point-in-time observational design collecting data on sleep patterns, digital habits, and academic metrics from a student cohort. Used to identify correlations between variables without establishing causality.

methods.name: Questionnaire data collection
methods.description: Structured survey instrument administering standardized scales for sleep quality (e.g., Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index), screen time logs, and academic stress assessment. Enabled multi-dimensional data capture across key variables.
